title: Cartel - Chroma @ 320 kbps
description:

Cartel has only been a band for a few short years, but the bandÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s members have known each other for well over a decade.

This record sounds like an inspired band who are unafraid to be inquisitive in their song craft and recording. It doesnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t stray far from their true sound, but at the very same time soars much higher and drags along with it noticeable influences from the bandÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s love for bands their parents listened to. Chroma reflects the bandÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ability and desire to write timeless songs with genuine subject matter and classic nature in the modern world of the benign and cold. The band attempts to take a step into the same ballpark as the staid records of their parentÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s generation that inspire for generations to come.

While Chroma is not a concept album, the album was built as a cohesive piece. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSettle DownÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ contains the darker undertones of the three, and the angst of young love with hope of lessons learned. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s not so much pop-punk anymore for the Atlanta boys, but more pop-rock, now laden with more alt-rock tinges and twists. Where bands in the ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢60s brought rock ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“nÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ roll out of the drab singles format, Cartel has a new direction and vision for their music, bringing surprise and intrigue. Chroma offers plenty of surprises while remaining culturally relevant and fresh. Cartel has opened their minds to new musical possibilities that challenge their peers to achieve something more. The band brings the best of both worlds in accessibility and artistry. Chroma also reveals PughÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s deep thoughts and philosophical questioning through bright melodies that stay in your head all day long. Cartel mesh loud, bombastic guitars with pretty melodies and rock arrangements with an acute sense of pop songwriting. The band started out as a guilty pleasure for many, they who are now demanding more and more.
